name: Carlos QUILES, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON OF PLEAS PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Quiles v. Court of Common of Pleas Philadelphia County

pin_cites.parenthetical: stating that hybrid representation is not permitted
stating that hybrid representation is not permitted

parties: Carlos QUILES, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON OF PLEAS PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 16th day of September, 2015, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Writ of Mandamus are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Ali, 608 Pa. 71, 10 A.3d 282 (2010) (stating that hybrid representation is not permitted). The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
122 A.3d 1034
Carlos QUILES, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON OF PLEAS PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent.
No. 85 EM 2015.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Sept. 16, 2015.
